questions.question_text: Proactive Customer Service Operations works Event Management to proactively monitor and fix issues affecting customers. It can also trigger case workflow’s and enable organizations to notify customers whose services or products are impacted by an outage or issue. What are the three main components that make up Proactive Customer Service Operations? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDF
E-book pág 110.

https://evantage.gilmoreglobal.com/reader/books/SN-CSMI-T010-PG-E/pageid/109

Selected Answer: BDF
BDF Is Correct

Selected Answer: BDF
Explanation: Proactive Customer Service Opreations contains 3 main components
 - Service Monitoring (NOC) | Monitor the health of products and services.
 - Service-aware Install Base (covered in CSMF) | Track confgiuration of service deployments.
 - Proactive Case | Proactively trigger case workflows.
Source: CSM Implementation ebook p.110

Selected Answer: BDF
See pg 110 of the Tokyo CSM Implementation book

given answer is correct
https://www.nowfedforum.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/proactive-customer-service-operations.pdf

Selected Answer: BC
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/reference/r_RolesInstalledWithCustomerService.html

Selected Answer: BC
BC is correct

Selected Answer: BC
Explanation: in order to view or modify a case from the customer serivce portal (external facing), following roles are required
 - sn_customerservice.customer
 - sn_customerservice.customer_admin (b.)
 - sn_customerservice.partner
 - sn_customerservice.partner_admin (c.)

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/t_ViewOrModCaseFromCustSlfServPrt.html

given answer is correct
https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0639072

discussion.content:

Selected Answer: B
Explanation: Auto Close Resolved Cases Flow Designer flow closes the case, however, "This flow is not active by default."

source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/auto-close-customer-service-case.html

comments.content: If the flow is active, it closes after how many days, 5 or 10, in cases of active flow?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct
Correct answer is B. In the url below it states that the flow is not active by default

comments.content: Cases are notautomatically closed by default. Correct answer is B.

discussion.content:
given answer is correct.
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/auto-close-customer-service-case.html

questions.question_text: The default configuration automatically closes resolved Cases after how many days?

choices.B: Cases are not automatically closed by default

questions.question_text: What are the different resource matching methods on the Matching Rule form? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCDF
E-book see 118.

https://evantage.gilmoreglobal.com/reader/books/SN-CSMI-T010-PG-E/pageid/117

Selected Answer: BCDF
Answer:
B. Scripted
C. Advanced
D. Simple
F. Selection Criteria
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/t_CreateARoutingRule.html

Selected Answer: BCDF
Answer:
 B. Scripted
 C. Advanced
 D. Simple
 F. Selection Criteria

Explanation: "The type of resource matching method to use for this rule: Simple, Advanced, Scripted, Selection Criteria."
